isis.stitle: BP-R1 BOBTAIL BRAKE PROPORTIONING RELAY VALVE AND LQ-5 BOBTAIL LIMITING VALVE - CLEAN AND INSPECT

svcproc.title: BP-R1 BOBTAIL BRAKE PROPORTIONING RELAY VALVE
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 15for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using mineral spirits or an equivalent solvent, clean and thoroughly dry all metal parts. Do not damage bores with metal tools.
Wash all non-metallic components (Items 4, 12, 16, 19, 22, 23, 27, 31) in a soap and water solution, making certain to rinse and dry thoroughly.

Inspect the interior and exterior of all metal parts that will be reused for severe corrosion, pitting, and cracks. Superficial corrosion and/or pitting on the exterior portion of the body (Item 1) and cover (Item 2) is acceptable. Replace the entire valve if the interior of the body or cover exhibits signs of corrosion or pitting.
Inspect each non-metallic component for cracks, wear or distortion. Replace the entire valve if any of these conditions are found.
Inspect the bores of the body (Item 1) and cover (Item 2) for deep scuffing or gouges. Replace the entire valve if either defect is found.
Make certain the air channel running between the top surface of the body (Item 1) and its supply port is clear and free of any obstruction.
Make certain all air channels and exhaust passages in the valve cover (Item 2) are clear and free of any obstruction.
Inspect the pipe threads in the body (Item 1) and valve cover (Item 2). Make certain they are clean and free of thread sealant.
Inspect all air line fittings for corrosion and replace as necessary. Make certain to remove all old thread sealant before reuse.
